meanings.sent1: The detective was sequestrating the evidence to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys sequestrating herself in her room to read books.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was sequestrating all the socks in the house.
meanings.sent4: The fog was sequestrating the entire town, making it seem mysterious.
meanings.sent5: The magician was sequestrating objects into thin air, amazing the audience.

meanings.definition: To confiscate or take possession of
meanings.sent1: The government was sequestrating illegal goods at the border.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to sequestrate the student's phone during class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was sequestrating all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The storm was sequestrating the beach, forcing everyone to seek shelter.
meanings.sent5: The security guard was sequestrating unauthorized visitors from entering the building.

meanings.definition: To set aside or reserve for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: She was sequestrating a portion of her salary for savings.
meanings.sent2: The chef was sequestrating the best ingredients for the special dish.
meanings.sent3: The kids were sequestrating the candies for a secret treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: The artist was sequestrating time each day for painting.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was sequestrating samples for further analysis.
